title: Understanding the Solubility Product
text: The solubility product constant (Ksp) is a measure of the solubility of a compound. It is the product of the concentrations of the ions each raised to the power of their coefficients in the balanced equation.

title: Write the Dissolution Equation
text: Write the balanced chemical equation for the dissolution of $$\operatorname{Mg}\left(OH\right) _2$$ in water.

title: Balanced Equation for Mg(OH)2 Dissolution
text: The balanced equation for the dissolution of $$\operatorname{Mg}\left(OH\right) _2$$ is: $$\operatorname{Mg}\left(OH\right) \operatorname{_2}\left(s\right)$$ ⇌ $${Mg}^2+aq$$ + $$2{OH}^{-aq}$$.

title: Express Ksp in Terms of Ion Concentrations
text: Using the balanced equation, express the solubility product (Ksp) in terms of the concentrations of Mg**2+ and OH**- ions.

title: Ksp Expression
text: The expression for Ksp is: Ksp $$=$$ $${[Mg**2+][OH**-][Mg**2+][OH**-]}^2$$.

title: Substitute Known Values
text: Substitute the known values into the Ksp expression. You know Ksp and $$[OH**-]$$.

title: Substitute and Solve
text: Substitute $$Ksp=1.2e-11$$ and $$[OH**-]=1.0e-7$$ into the expression: $$1.2e-11$$ $$=$$ $${\operatorname{[Mg**2+]}\left(1e-7\right)}^2$$. Solve for $$[Mg**2+]$$.

title: Calculate the Molar Solubility
text: Calculate the molar solubility of $$\operatorname{Mg}\left(OH\right) _2$$ using the expression you derived.
